Key Match Events: Brayan Rocchio drove in four runs, leading the Cleveland Guardians to a 7-1 win over the Kansas City Royals.
Kansas City Royals extended their losing streak to a season-high seven games.
Tanner Bibee allowed one run and two hits in six innings, marking the 39th time a Cleveland starter pitched six or more innings.
Bobby Witt Jr. had his big league-best 57th multihit game of the season.
Rocchio hit his seventh home run of the season in the bottom of the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Guardians manager Stephen Vogt praised Tanner Bibee for his performance, especially in high-pressure moments.
Royals bench coach Paul Hoover, serving as acting manager, commented on the team's need to string together successful at-bats.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Royals manager Matt Quatraro missed his second game after the death of his mother.
Cleveland first baseman Josh Naylor left the game due to lower back tightness.
Royals 1B-3B Yuli Gurriel is listed as day to day with right hamstring tightness.
Others: The game was held at Kauffman Stadium in Kansas City, Missouri.
The game lasted 2 hours and 48 minutes.
